<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 6"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Shield Wall](/Feats.aspx?ID=3634) <actions string="Reaction" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Champion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=24" />
<trait label="Fighter" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=71" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Knights of Lastwall](/Sources.aspx?ID=123) pg. 84</row>

**Access**
Knights of Lastwall have access to this feat.

**Trigger**
Your shield is raised and an adjacent ally [Raises a Shield](/Actions.aspx?ID=98).

</column>

---

You use your shield in tandem with an ally's, forming a barricade. Both you and the triggering creature have [standard cover](/Rules.aspx?ID=459) as long as you remain adjacent to each other and you both have your shields raised; when this is no longer the case, the effect ends. You and your ally can't use this cover to [Hide](/Actions.aspx?ID=62), as it's obvious you're standing there holding your shields, but you and your ally can use it to [Take Cover](/Actions.aspx?ID=90). Normally, if you and your ally don't move, Shield Wall lasts until the beginning of your next turn, when your shield is no longer raised.
